pullrequest.title: New start gate and ROS service to finish the game

content.raw:
**Update:** I added them to the ruby script `tile.world.erb` so the starting area and the plugin are automatically inserted. The objects of interest are not generated at the moment while the GameLogicPlugin takes them as parameters. [#!/osrf/subt/commits/d1567a193254b78e168b4d2b46b18c21f57f60f6#Lsubt\_gazebo/worlds/tile.world.erbT240](#!/osrf/subt/commits/d1567a193254b78e168b4d2b46b18c21f57f60f6#Lsubt_gazebo/worlds/tile.world.erbT240)

Also, maybe because of the different random seed, the generated world has additional changes.
content.html:
Update: I added them to the ruby script tile.world.erb so the starting area and the plugin are automatically inserted. The objects of interest are not generated at the moment while the GameLogicPlugin takes them as parameters. #!/osrf/subt/commits/d1567a193254b78e168b4d2b46b18c21f57f60f6#Lsubt_gazebo/worlds/tile.world.erbT240

Also, maybe because of the different random seed, the generated world has additional changes.

pullrequest.title: New start gate and ROS service to finish the game

content.raw: I think we talked about adding a contact sensor to the link containing the “special” collision element. This callback will receive a message every time that a new contact is triggered in the entire world, which in our case could be huge. If we use the sensor, the contact should be triggered only when a new model crosses the gate. In fact, you could unsubscribe when the first robot crosses the gate, as you’re not interested anymore.
content.html: I think we talked about adding a contact sensor to the link containing the “special” collision element. This callback will receive a message every time that a new contact is triggered in the entire world, which in our case could be huge. If we use the sensor, the contact should be triggered only when a new model crosses the gate. In fact, you could unsubscribe when the first robot crosses the gate, as you’re not interested anymore.

pullrequest.title: New start gate and ROS service to finish the game

content.raw:
I added TouchPlugin so that GameLogicPlugin receives a message only once an object enters the start area. This is now included in `lava_tube.world` and `tile.world.erb` \(and the generated `cave.world`\)

**P.S.** TouchPlugin seems to automatically stops once it detects the collision so I just let GameLogicPlugin subscribing it after receiving the message. But should I make the plugin to unsubsribe it?
content.html:
I added TouchPlugin so that GameLogicPlugin receives a message only once an object enters the start area. This is now included in lava_tube.world and tile.world.erb (and the generated cave.world)

P.S. TouchPlugin seems to automatically stops once it detects the collision so I just let GameLogicPlugin subscribing it after receiving the message. But should I make the plugin to unsubsribe it?
